questions.question: "KALTXÌ", WHICH MEANS THIS IN ENGLISH, APPEARS ON THE DISNEY BUSES HEADED TOWARDS ANIMAL KINGDOM; IT'S ALSO WHAT YOU MIGHT SAY TO YOUR DRIVER AS YOU GET ON.
PUT UP TWO, FIVE, AND THIS WORD, WHICH IS NA'VI FOR "PRETTY".
WHEN BOARDING FLIGHT OF PASSAGE, IF YOU SEE SOMEONE SIT DOWN ON THEIR LINK CHAIR BACKWARDS, YOU COULD PROBABLY CALL THEM A "SKXAWNG", MEANING THIS.
ALTHOUGH NA'VI ISN'T A TRANSCRIBED LANGUAGE, IT DOES HAVE THE VERB "PAMREL SI" IN IT; A LITERAL TRANSLATION IS "MAKE A PICTURE SOUND", BUT IT'S BETTER TRANSLATED AS THIS.
ALL THESE QUESTIONS HAVE HAD A LITTLE BIT OF THIS, THE "LÌ'FYA LENA'VI", IN THEM.
